comments.body:
To use optional chaining, we need to fix the syntax error of the build.
https://ci.nodejs.org/job/node-test-linter/37662/console

```
20:13:32 Running JS linter...
20:13:33 
20:13:33 Oops! Something went wrong! :(
20:13:33 
20:13:33 ESLint: 7.12.1
20:13:33 
20:13:33 /home/iojs/build/workspace/node-test-linter@2/tools/eslint-rules/prefer-primordials.js:26
20:13:33   return map.get(varName)?.get(propName)?.ignored ?? false;
20:13:33                           ^
20:13:33 
20:13:33 SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.'
20:13:33     at new Script (vm.js:88:7)
...
```
@nodejs/ci-config-travis-maintainers is it possible to use Node.js 14 for the linter CI?

ci.nodejs.org is Jenkins, not Travis. So if it's a job on ci.nodejs.org you're asking about, I think you'd want to ping `@nodejs/jenkins-admins`. (Not pinging myself in case I'm misunderstanding something here and this really is about the Travis configs in https://github.com/nodejs/ci-config-travis or something like that.)

This is definitely about the configuration used to run the `node‑test‑linter` **Jenkins CI** job, so it needs mentioning @nodejs/jenkins‑admins. (I can’t do it as I’m not a member of @nodejs) --- Also, **Node** isn’t being built on **Travis**, only on **Jenkins** and **GitHub CI**.

Thanks @Trott and @ExE-Boss, you're right. Sorry for having sent unsolicited pings to folks, I should have known better.

@nodejs/jenkins-admins do you know if we can use a more modern version of Node.js on the `node-test-linter` job?
